info.title: OpenPhotobox API
info.description: Family photo management system with face recognition, albums, and sharing

get.description: List users (GET) or create new user (POST) - admin only

post.description: List users (GET) or create new user (POST) - admin only

get.description:
ViewSet for managing photo albums.

Albums are collections of photos that can be organized and shared.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description:
ViewSet for managing photo albums.

Albums are collections of photos that can be organized and shared.

get.description:
ViewSet for managing photo albums.

Albums are collections of photos that can be organized and shared.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

put.description: Only allow owner to update album

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

patch.description: Only allow owner to partially update album

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

delete.description: Only allow owner to delete album

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

post.description:
Add photos to this album.

POST /api/albums/{id}/add_photos/
Body: {"asset_ids": ["uuid1", "uuid2", ...]}

Requires contribute permission (owner or shared with contribute permission)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

post.description:
Remove photos from this album.

POST /api/albums/{id}/remove_photos/
Body: {"asset_ids": ["uuid1", "uuid2", ...]}

Requires contribute permission (owner or shared with contribute permission)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

post.description:
Share this album with another user.

POST /api/albums/{id}/share/
Body: {
    "user_id": "uuid",
    "permission_level": "view" or "contribute"
}

Only the album owner can share the album.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

get.description:
List all shares for this album.

GET /api/albums/{id}/shares/

Only the album owner can see the shares list.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

post.description:
Unshare this album with a user (remove sharing).

POST /api/albums/{id}/unshare/
Body: {"user_id": "uuid"}

Only the album owner can unshare the album.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

patch.description:
Update permission level for an existing share.

PATCH /api/albums/{id}/update_share/
Body: {
    "user_id": "uuid",
    "permission_level": "view" or "contribute"
}

Only the album owner can update share permissions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this album.

get.description:
Return all assets for a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD) for a section.
Minimal fields for the gallery.
Query param: date=YYYY-MM-DD

Lightweight gallery listing for the main grid.
Returns minimal fields with cursor pagination.
Accepts same filters as list().

Return assets that became ready (have a ready thumbnail) since a given ISO timestamp.
Query params: since=ISO8601, limit (default 100)

post.description:
Simple storage setup - provide a path and we'll handle the rest.

POST /api/storage/setup/
{
    "path": "/home/user/photos"
}

This will:
- Create a StorageBackend with the path
- Create originals and thumbnails buckets
- Set everything as default
- Create the directory structure

get.description:
Simple storage status check.

GET /api/storage/status/

Returns:
{
    "configured": true/false,
    "path": "/path/to/storage" or null
}

Return available photo dates and counts for the timeline sidebar.
Groups by capture day (YYYY-MM-DD) using taken_at if present, else created_at.

post.description:
Direct file upload to local filesystem storage.

POST /api/assets/upload_file/
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

Body:
    file: binary file data
    bucket_id (optional): target bucket ID (defaults to originals bucket)
    metadata (optional): JSON string with additional metadata

Returns:
    Asset details including asset_id
Change user password
User login
User logout

get.description: Get user profile

General-purpose search endpoint supporting semantic CLIP search and people-only filtering.

Returns full asset objects with thumbnails, likes, and comments (not just IDs).

Query params:
  - q (text, optional): CLIP semantic search query
  - people (comma-separated UUIDs): filter by people
  - people_mode: 'all' | 'any' (default 'all')
  - albums (comma-separated UUIDs): filter by albums
  - start_date, end_date (ISO format): date range filter
  - visibility: 'shared' | 'private'
  - limit (default 50), offset

When no query is provided but people are specified, returns chronologically ordered results without CLIP computation.

Return nearest neighbor assets by CLIP embedding for a given asset.

Query params:
  - asset_id (required)
  - k (default 5): number of neighbors per asset
  - max_distance (optional): filter results to distances <= max_distance

These are faces that were auto-assigned but haven't been confirmed by a user.

get.description:
Return candidate persons for this face, ranked by similarity.
Query params: limit (default 50)

parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this face.

post.description:
Assign one or more faces to a person.
Body: { face_ids: [uuid,...], person_id: uuid }

Confirm one or more faces (mark as confirmed by user).
Body: { face_ids: [uuid,...] }

Create a manual face selection on an asset and enqueue embedding + thumbnail.
Body: { asset_id: uuid, x:0..1, y:0..1, w:0..1, h:0..1, person_id?: uuid }

Unassign one or more faces from any person (set person to null).
Body: { face_ids: [uuid,...] }

get.description:
List assets that have at least one unassigned face (person is null).
Cursor-paginated and uses the asset gallery serializer for lightweight payload.
Query params: cursor, limit
